prompt: <description>Part 1: A Curved Rectangular Prism Construct a curved rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0°, 0°, and 0°, and translation vector of 0, 0, 0. Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. This sketch will be used to create the outline of the prism. Draw a polyline with the following vertices: * Vertex 1: (0, 0) * Vertex 2: (0.0572, 0.2945) * Vertex 3: (0.0463, 0.3509) * Vertex 4: (0.0739, 0.3562) * Vertex 5: (0.0859, 0.2945) * Vertex 6: (0.0341, 0.0281) * Vertex 7: (0.0938, 0.0281) * Vertex 8: (0.0938, 0) * Vertex 9: (0, 0) The polyline should be closed, joining Vertex 1 to Vertex 9. This forms the bottom face of the prism. Draw a circle with center at (0.0572, 0.2945) and radius of 0.0178. This forms the curved side of the prism. Use the SKETCH_SCALE scaling parameter of 0.3562 to scale the sketch. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, setting the euler angles to 0°, 0°, and 0°, and the translation vector to 0, 0, 0. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.75 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction of the normal, creating a solid body. The prism has a length of 0.3563 units, a width of 0.3563 units, and a height of 0.75 units. Part 2 [Add instructions for Part 2 here] Part 3 [Add instructions for Part 3 here] Final Shape The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. [Add instructions for creating the final shape here]</description>
